verses.translation: (1) Ṭā, Seen, Meem.[1043]
(2) These are the verses of the clear Book.

verses.arabic_text: لَعَلَّكَ بَٰخِعٞ نَّفۡسَكَ أَلَّا يَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (3) Perhaps, [O Muḥammad], you would kill yourself with grief that they will not be believers.

verses.arabic_text: إِن نَّشَأۡ نُنَزِّلۡ عَلَيۡهِم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ ءَايَةٗ فَظَلَّتۡ أَعۡنَٰقُهُمۡ لَهَا خَٰضِعِينَ
verses.translation: (4) If We willed, We could send down to them from the sky a sign for which their necks would remain humbled.[1044]

verses.arabic_text: وَمَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن ذِكۡرٖ مِّنَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِ مُحۡدَثٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهُ مُعۡرِضِينَ
verses.translation: (5) And no mention [i.e., revelation] comes to them anew from the Most Merciful except that they turn away from it.

verses.arabic_text: فَقَدۡ كَذَّبُواْ فَسَيَأۡتِيهِمۡ أَنۢبَٰٓؤُاْ مَا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ
verses.translation: (6) For they have already denied, but there will come to them the news of that which they used to ridicule.

verses.arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ إِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَمۡ أَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا مِن كُلِّ زَوۡجٖ كَرِيمٍ
verses.translation: (7) Did they not look at the earth - how much We have produced therein from every noble kind?

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (8) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(9) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.

verses.arabic_text: وَإِذۡ نَادَىٰ رَبُّكَ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱئۡتِ ٱلۡقَوۡمَ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ
verses.translation: (10) And [mention] when your Lord called Moses, [saying], "Go to the wrongdoing people -
(11) The people of Pharaoh. Will they not fear Allāh?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبِّ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ أَن يُكَذِّبُونِ
verses.translation: (12) He said, "My Lord, indeed I fear that they will deny me

verses.arabic_text: وَيَضِيقُ صَدۡرِي وَلَا يَنطَلِقُ لِسَانِي فَأَرۡسِلۡ إِلَىٰ هَٰرُونَ
verses.translation: (13) And that my breast will tighten and my tongue will not be fluent, so send for Aaron.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَهُمۡ عَلَيَّ ذَنۢبٞ فَأَخَافُ أَن يَقۡتُلُونِ
verses.translation: (14) And they have upon me a [claim due to] sin, so I fear that they will kill me."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّاۖ فَٱذۡهَبَا بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآۖ إِنَّا مَعَكُم مُّسۡتَمِعُونَ
verses.translation: (15) [Allāh] said, "No. Go both of you with Our signs; indeed, We are with you, listening.

verses.arabic_text: فَأۡتِيَا فِرۡعَوۡنَ فَقُولَآ إِنَّا رَسُولُ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (16) Go to Pharaoh and say, 'We are the messengers[1045] of the Lord of the worlds,
(17) [Commanded to say], "Send with us the Children of Israel."'"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ أَلَمۡ نُرَبِّكَ فِينَا وَلِيدٗا وَلَبِثۡتَ فِينَا مِنۡ عُمُرِكَ سِنِينَ
verses.translation: (18) [Pharaoh] said, "Did we not raise you among us as a child, and you remained among us for years of your life?

verses.arabic_text: وَفَعَلۡتَ فَعۡلَتَكَ ٱلَّتِي فَعَلۡتَ وَأَنتَ مِنَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
verses.translation: (19) And [then] you did your deed which you did,[1046] and you were of the ungrateful."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ فَعَلۡتُهَآ إِذٗا وَأَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.translation: (20) [Moses] said, "I did it, then, while I was of those astray [i.e., ignorant].

verses.arabic_text: فَفَرَرۡتُ مِنكُمۡ لَمَّا خِفۡتُكُمۡ فَوَهَبَ لِي رَبِّي حُكۡمٗا وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ
verses.translation: (21) So I fled from you when I feared you. Then my Lord granted me judgement [i.e., wisdom and prophethood] and appointed me [as one] of the messengers.

verses.arabic_text: وَتِلۡكَ نِعۡمَةٞ تَمُنُّهَا عَلَيَّ أَنۡ عَبَّدتَّ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.translation: (22) And is this a favor of which you remind me - that you have enslaved the Children of Israel?"
(23) Said Pharaoh, "And what is the Lord of the worlds?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُم مُّوقِنِينَ
verses.translation: (24) [Moses] said, "The Lord of the heavens and earth and that between them, if you should be convinced."
(25) [Pharaoh] said to those around him, "Do you not hear?"
(26) [Moses] said, "Your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ إِنَّ رَسُولَكُمُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أُرۡسِلَ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمَجۡنُونٞ
verses.translation: (27) [Pharaoh] said,[1047] "Indeed, your 'messenger' who has been sent to you is mad."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَآۖ إِن كُنتُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
verses.translation: (28) [Moses] said, "Lord of the east and the west and that between them, if you were to reason."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ لَئِنِ ٱتَّخَذۡتَ إِلَٰهًا غَيۡرِي لَأَجۡعَلَنَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمَسۡجُونِينَ
verses.translation: (29) [Pharaoh] said, "If you take a god other than me, I will surely place you among those imprisoned."
(30) [Moses] said, "Even if I brought you something [i.e., proof] manifest?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ فَأۡتِ بِهِۦٓ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: (31) [Pharaoh] said, "Then bring it, if you should be of the truthful."

verses.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ ثُعۡبَانٞ مُّبِينٞ
verses.translation: (32) So [Moses] threw his staff, and suddenly it was a serpent manifest.[1048]

verses.arabic_text: وَنَزَعَ يَدَهُۥ فَإِذَا هِيَ بَيۡضَآءُ لِلنَّٰظِرِينَ
verses.translation: (33) And he drew out his hand; thereupon it was white for the observers.

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ لِلۡمَلَإِ حَوۡلَهُۥٓ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَسَٰحِرٌ عَلِيمٞ
verses.translation: (34) [Pharaoh] said to the eminent ones around him, "Indeed, this is a learned magician.

verses.arabic_text: يُرِيدُ أَن يُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنۡ أَرۡضِكُم بِسِحۡرِهِۦ فَمَاذَا تَأۡمُرُونَ
verses.translation: (35) He wants to drive you out of your land by his magic, so what do you advise?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالُوٓاْ أَرۡجِهۡ وَأَخَاهُ وَٱبۡعَثۡ فِي ٱلۡمَدَآئِنِ حَٰشِرِينَ
verses.translation: (36) They said, "Postpone [the matter of] him and his brother and send among the cities gatherers
(37) Who will bring you every learned, skilled magician."
(38) So the magicians were assembled for the appointment of a well-known day.[1049]
(39) And it was said to the people, "Will you congregate

verses.arabic_text: لَعَلَّنَا نَتَّبِعُ ٱلسَّحَرَةَ إِن كَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
verses.translation: (40) That we might follow the magicians if they are the predominant?"

verses.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ ٱلسَّحَرَةُ قَالُواْ لِفِرۡعَوۡنَ أَئِنَّ لَنَا لَأَجۡرًا إِن كُنَّا نَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ
verses.translation: (41) And when the magicians arrived, they said to Pharaoh, "Is there indeed for us a reward if we are the predominant?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ نَعَمۡ وَإِنَّكُمۡ إِذٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ
verses.translation: (42) He said, "Yes, and indeed, you will then be of those near [to me]."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ لَهُم مُّوسَىٰٓ أَلۡقُواْ مَآ أَنتُم مُّلۡقُونَ
verses.translation: (43) Moses said to them, "Throw whatever you will throw."

verses.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَوۡاْ حِبَالَهُمۡ وَعِصِيَّهُمۡ وَقَالُواْ بِعِزَّةِ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
verses.translation: (44) So they threw their ropes and their staffs and said, "By the might of Pharaoh, indeed it is we who are predominant."

verses.arabic_text: فَأَلۡقَىٰ مُوسَىٰ عَصَاهُ فَإِذَا هِيَ تَلۡقَفُ مَا يَأۡفِكُونَ
verses.translation: (45) Then Moses threw his staff, and at once it devoured what they falsified.
(46) So the magicians fell down in prostration [to Allāh].
(47) They said, "We have believed in the Lord of the worlds,
(48) The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ ءَامَنتُمۡ لَهُۥ قَبۡلَ أَنۡ ءَاذَنَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكَبِيرُكُمُ ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَكُمُ ٱلسِّحۡرَ فَلَسَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَۚ لَأُقَطِّعَنَّ أَيۡدِيَكُمۡ وَأَرۡجُلَكُم مِّنۡ خِلَٰفٖ وَلَأُصَلِّبَنَّكُمۡ أَجۡمَعِينَ
verses.translation: (49) [Pharaoh] said, "You believed him [i.e., Moses] before I gave you permission. Indeed, he is your leader who has taught you magic, but you are going to know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet on opposite sides, and I will surely crucify you all."

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَا ضَيۡرَۖ إِنَّآ إِلَىٰ رَبِّنَا مُنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: (50) They said, "No harm. Indeed, to our Lord we will return.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّا نَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لَنَا رَبُّنَا خَطَٰيَٰنَآ أَن كُنَّآ أَوَّلَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (51) Indeed, we aspire that our Lord will forgive us our sins because we were the first of the believers."

verses.arabic_text: ۞ وَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنۡ أَسۡرِ بِعِبَادِيٓ إِنَّكُم مُّتَّبَعُونَ
verses.translation: (52) And We inspired to Moses, "Travel by night with My servants; indeed, you will be pursued."
(53) Then Pharaoh sent among the cities gatherers[1050]
(54) [And said], "Indeed, those are but a small band,
(55) And indeed, they are enraging us,
(56) And indeed, we are a cautious society..."
(57) So We removed them from gardens and springs
(58) And treasures and honorable station[1051] -
(59) Thus. And We caused to inherit it the Children of Israel.
(60) So they pursued them at sunrise.

verses.arabic_text: فَلَمَّا تَرَٰٓءَا ٱلۡجَمۡعَانِ قَالَ أَصۡحَٰبُ مُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّا لَمُدۡرَكُونَ
verses.translation: (61) And when the two companies saw one another, the companions of Moses said, "Indeed, we are to be overtaken!"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ كَلَّآۖ إِنَّ مَعِيَ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ
verses.translation: (62) [Moses] said, "No! Indeed, with me is my Lord; He will guide me."

verses.arabic_text: فَأَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَىٰ مُوسَىٰٓ أَنِ ٱضۡرِب بِّعَصَاكَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَۖ فَٱنفَلَقَ فَكَانَ كُلُّ فِرۡقٖ كَٱلطَّوۡدِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
verses.translation: (63) Then We inspired to Moses, "Strike with your staff the sea," and it parted, and each portion was like a great towering mountain.
(64) And We advanced thereto the others [i.e., the pursuers].
(65) And We saved Moses and those with him, all together.
(66) Then We drowned the others.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (67) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(68) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(69) And recite to them the news of Abraham,

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: (70) When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ نَعۡبُدُ أَصۡنَامٗا فَنَظَلُّ لَهَا عَٰكِفِينَ
verses.translation: (71) They said, "We worship idols and remain to them devoted."
(72) He said, "Do they hear you when you supplicate?
(73) Or do they benefit you, or do they harm?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ بَلۡ وَجَدۡنَآ ءَابَآءَنَا كَذَٰلِكَ يَفۡعَلُونَ
verses.translation: (74) They said, "But we found our fathers doing thus."
(75) He said, "Then do you see what you have been worshipping,
(76) You and your ancient forefathers?

verses.arabic_text: فَإِنَّهُمۡ عَدُوّٞ لِّيٓ إِلَّا رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (77) Indeed, they are enemies to me, except the Lord of the worlds,[1052]
(78) Who created me, and He [it is who] guides me.
(79) And it is He who feeds me and gives me drink.
(80) And when I am ill, it is He who cures me
(81) And who will cause me to die and then bring me to life

verses.arabic_text: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡمَعُ أَن يَغۡفِرَ لِي خَطِيٓـَٔتِي يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ
verses.translation: (82) And who I aspire that He will forgive me my sin on the Day of Recompense."

verses.arabic_text: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي حُكۡمٗا وَأَلۡحِقۡنِي بِٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
verses.translation: (83) [And he said], "My Lord, grant me authority and join me with the righteous.

verses.arabic_text: وَٱجۡعَل لِّي لِسَانَ صِدۡقٖ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ
verses.translation: (84) And grant me a mention [i.e., reputation] of honor among later generations.
(85) And place me among the inheritors of the Garden of Pleasure.

verses.arabic_text: وَٱغۡفِرۡ لِأَبِيٓ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ
verses.translation: (86) And forgive my father. Indeed, he has been of those astray.
(87) And do not disgrace me on the Day they are [all] resurrected -

verses.arabic_text: يَوۡمَ لَا يَنفَعُ مَالٞ وَلَا بَنُونَ
verses.translation: (88) The Day when there will not benefit [anyone] wealth or children

verses.arabic_text: إِلَّا مَنۡ أَتَى ٱللَّهَ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٖ
verses.translation: (89) But only one who comes to Allāh with a sound heart."
(90) And Paradise will be brought near [that Day] to the righteous.
(91) And Hellfire will be brought forth for the deviators,

verses.arabic_text: وَقِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡبُدُونَ
verses.translation: (92) And it will be said to them, "Where are those you used to worship

verses.arabic_text: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ هَلۡ يَنصُرُونَكُمۡ أَوۡ يَنتَصِرُونَ
verses.translation: (93) Other than Allāh? Can they help you or help themselves?"
(94) So they will be overturned into it [i.e., Hellfire], they and the deviators
(95) And the soldiers of Iblees, all together.
(96) They will say while they dispute therein,

verses.arabic_text: تَٱللَّهِ إِن كُنَّا لَفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ
verses.translation: (97) "By Allāh, we were indeed in manifest error
(98) When we equated you with the Lord of the worlds.
(99) And no one misguided us except the criminals.
(100) So now we have no intercessors
(101) And not a devoted friend.

verses.arabic_text: فَلَوۡ أَنَّ لَنَا كَرَّةٗ فَنَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (102) Then if we only had a return [to the world] and could be of the believers..."[1053]

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (103) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(104) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(105) The people of Noah denied the messengers[1054]

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ نُوحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: (106) When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(107) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(108) So fear Allāh and obey me.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (109) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
(110) So fear Allāh and obey me."
(111) They said, "Should we believe you while you are followed by the lowest [class of people]?"

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ وَمَا عِلۡمِي بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: (112) He said, "And what is my knowledge of what they used to do?

verses.arabic_text: إِنۡ حِسَابُهُمۡ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّيۖ لَوۡ تَشۡعُرُونَ
verses.translation: (113) Their account is only upon my Lord, if you [could] perceive.
(114) And I am not one to drive away the believers.
(115) I am only a clear warner."

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰنُوحُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمَرۡجُومِينَ
verses.translation: (116) They said, "If you do not desist, O Noah, you will surely be of those who are stoned."
(117) He said, "My Lord, indeed my people have denied me.

verses.arabic_text: فَٱفۡتَحۡ بَيۡنِي وَبَيۡنَهُمۡ فَتۡحٗا وَنَجِّنِي وَمَن مَّعِيَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (118) Then judge between me and them with decisive judgement and save me and those with me of the believers."

verses.arabic_text: فَأَنجَيۡنَٰهُ وَمَن مَّعَهُۥ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
verses.translation: (119) So We saved him and those with him in the laden ship.
(120) Then We drowned thereafter the remaining ones.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (121) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(122) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(123) ʿAad denied the messengers

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ هُودٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: (124) When their brother Hūd said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(125) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(126) So fear Allāh and obey me.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (127) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
(128) Do you construct on every elevation a sign,[1055] amusing yourselves,
(129) And take for yourselves constructions [i.e., palaces and fortresses] that you might abide eternally?
(130) And when you strike, you strike as tyrants.
(131) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(132) And fear He who provided you with that which you know,
(133) Provided you with grazing livestock and children
(134) And gardens and springs.

verses.arabic_text: إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
verses.translation: (135) Indeed, I fear for you the punishment of a terrible day."

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ سَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡنَآ أَوَعَظۡتَ أَمۡ لَمۡ تَكُن مِّنَ ٱلۡوَٰعِظِينَ
verses.translation: (136) They said, "It is all the same to us whether you advise or are not of the advisors.
(137) This is not but the custom of the former peoples,
(138) And we are not to be punished."

verses.arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَهۡلَكۡنَٰهُمۡۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (139) And they denied him, so We destroyed them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(140) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(141) Thamūd denied the messengers

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ صَٰلِحٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: (142) When their brother Ṣāliḥ said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(143) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(144) So fear Allāh and obey me.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (145) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
(146) Will you be left in what is here, secure [from death],
(147) Within gardens and springs
(148) And fields of crops and palm trees with softened fruit?
(149) And you carve out of the mountains, homes, with skill.
(150) So fear Allāh and obey me.
(151) And do not obey the order of the transgressors,

verses.arabic_text: ٱلَّذِينَ يُفۡسِدُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا يُصۡلِحُونَ
verses.translation: (152) Who cause corruption in the land and do not amend."
(153) They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

verses.arabic_text: مَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا فَأۡتِ بِـَٔايَةٍ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: (154) You are but a man like ourselves, so bring a sign, if you should be of the truthful."

verses.arabic_text: قَالَ هَٰذِهِۦ نَاقَةٞ لَّهَا شِرۡبٞ وَلَكُمۡ شِرۡبُ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ
verses.translation: (155) He said, "This is a she-camel.[1056] For her is a [time of] drink, and for you is a [time of] drink, [each] on a known day.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَا تَمَسُّوهَا بِسُوٓءٖ فَيَأۡخُذَكُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ
verses.translation: (156) And do not touch her with harm, lest you be seized by the punishment of a terrible day."
(157) But they hamstrung her and so became regretful.

verses.arabic_text: فَأَخَذَهُمُ ٱلۡعَذَابُۚ إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (158) And the punishment seized them. Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(159) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(160) The people of Lot denied the messengers

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ أَخُوهُمۡ لُوطٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: (161) When their brother Lot said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(162) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(163) So fear Allāh and obey me.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (164) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.
(165) Do you approach males among the worlds[1057]

verses.arabic_text: وَتَذَرُونَ مَا خَلَقَ لَكُمۡ رَبُّكُم مِّنۡ أَزۡوَٰجِكُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٌ عَادُونَ
verses.translation: (166) And leave what your Lord has created for you as mates? But you are a people transgressing."

verses.arabic_text: قَالُواْ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهِ يَٰلُوطُ لَتَكُونَنَّ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡرَجِينَ
verses.translation: (167) They said, "If you do not desist, O Lot, you will surely be of those evicted."
(168) He said, "Indeed, I am, toward your deed, of those who detest [it].
(169) My Lord, save me and my family from [the consequence of] what they do."
(170) So We saved him and his family, all,
(171) Except an old woman[1058] among those who remained behind.
(172) Then We destroyed the others.

verses.arabic_text: وَأَمۡطَرۡنَا عَلَيۡهِم مَّطَرٗاۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ
verses.translation: (173) And We rained upon them a rain [of stones], and evil was the rain of those who were warned.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (174) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(175) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(176) The companions of the thicket [i.e., the people of Madyan] denied the messengers

verses.arabic_text: إِذۡ قَالَ لَهُمۡ شُعَيۡبٌ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ
verses.translation: (177) When Shuʿayb said to them, "Will you not fear Allāh?
(178) Indeed, I am to you a trustworthy messenger.
(179) So fear Allāh and obey me.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ أَجۡرٍۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَىٰ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
verses.translation: (180) And I do not ask you for it any payment. My payment is only from the Lord of the worlds.

verses.arabic_text: ۞ أَوۡفُواْ ٱلۡكَيۡلَ وَلَا تَكُونُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡمُخۡسِرِينَ
verses.translation: (181) Give full measure and do not be of those who cause loss.
(182) And weigh with an even [i.e., honest] balance.

verses.arabic_text: وَلَا تَبۡخَسُواْ ٱلنَّاسَ أَشۡيَآءَهُمۡ وَلَا تَعۡثَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ مُفۡسِدِينَ
verses.translation: (183) And do not deprive people of their due and do not commit abuse on earth, spreading corruption.
(184) And fear He who created you and the former creation."[1059]
(185) They said, "You are only of those affected by magic.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَنتَ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَإِن نَّظُنُّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡكَٰذِبِينَ
verses.translation: (186) You are but a man like ourselves, and indeed, we think you are among the liars.

verses.arabic_text: فَأَسۡقِطۡ عَلَيۡنَا كِسَفٗا مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ إِن كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰدِقِينَ
verses.translation: (187) So cause to fall upon us fragments of the sky, if you should be of the truthful."
(188) He said, "My Lord is most knowing of what you do."

verses.arabic_text: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَأَخَذَهُمۡ عَذَابُ يَوۡمِ ٱلظُّلَّةِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَذَابَ يَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٍ
verses.translation: (189) And they denied him, so the punishment of the day of the black cloud seized them. Indeed, it was the punishment of a terrible day.

verses.arabic_text: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَأٓيَةٗۖ وَمَا كَانَ أَكۡثَرُهُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (190) Indeed in that is a sign, but most of them were not to be believers.
(191) And indeed, your Lord - He is the Exalted in Might, the Merciful.
(192) And indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
(193) The Trustworthy Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] has brought it down
(194) Upon your heart, [O Muḥammad] - that you may be of the warners
(195) In a clear Arabic language.
(196) And indeed, it is [mentioned] in the scriptures of former peoples.

verses.arabic_text: أَوَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُمۡ ءَايَةً أَن يَعۡلَمَهُۥ عُلَمَٰٓؤُاْ بَنِيٓ إِسۡرَٰٓءِيلَ
verses.translation: (197) And has it not been a sign to them that it is recognized by the scholars of the Children of Israel?
(198) And even if We had revealed it to one among the foreigners[1060]

verses.arabic_text: فَقَرَأَهُۥ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ مُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (199) And he had recited it to them [perfectly],[1061] they would [still] not have been believers in it.
(200) Thus have We inserted it [i.e., disbelief] into the hearts of the criminals.

verses.arabic_text: لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِهِۦ حَتَّىٰ يَرَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَلِيمَ
verses.translation: (201) They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment.
(202) And it will come to them suddenly while they perceive [it] not.
(203) And they will say, "May we be reprieved?"
(204) So for Our punishment are they impatient?
(205) Then have you considered if We gave them enjoyment for years
(206) And then there came to them that which they were promised?

verses.arabic_text: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُم مَّا كَانُواْ يُمَتَّعُونَ
verses.translation: (207) They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.

verses.arabic_text: وَمَآ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَرۡيَةٍ إِلَّا لَهَا مُنذِرُونَ
verses.translation: (208) And We did not destroy any city except that it had warners
(209) As a reminder; and never have We been unjust.
(210) And the devils have not brought it [i.e., the revelation] down.[1062]
(211) It is not allowable for them, nor would they be able.
(212) Indeed they, from [its] hearing, are removed.[1063]

verses.arabic_text: فَلَا تَدۡعُ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ إِلَٰهًا ءَاخَرَ فَتَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُعَذَّبِينَ
verses.translation: (213) So do not invoke[1064] with Allāh another deity and [thus] be among the punished.
(214) And warn, [O Muḥammad], your closest kindred.

verses.arabic_text: وَٱخۡفِضۡ جَنَاحَكَ لِمَنِ ٱتَّبَعَكَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ
verses.translation: (215) And lower your wing [i.e., show kindness] to those who follow you of the believers.

verses.arabic_text: فَإِنۡ عَصَوۡكَ فَقُلۡ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّمَّا تَعۡمَلُونَ
verses.translation: (216) And if they disobey you, then say, "Indeed, I am disassociated from what you are doing."
(217) And rely upon the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
(218) Who sees you when you arise[1065]
(219) And your movement among those who prostrate.[1066]
(220) Indeed, He is the Hearing, the Knowing.

verses.arabic_text: هَلۡ أُنَبِّئُكُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَن تَنَزَّلُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينُ
verses.translation: (221) Shall I inform you upon whom the devils descend?
(222) They descend upon every sinful liar.
(223) They pass on what is heard,[1067] and most of them are liars.
(224) And the poets - [only] the deviators follow them.

verses.arabic_text: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّهُمۡ فِي كُلِّ وَادٖ يَهِيمُونَ
verses.translation: (225) Do you not see that in every valley they roam[1068]
(226) And that they say what they do not do? -

verses.arabic_text: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَذَكَرُواْ ٱللَّهَ كَثِيرٗا وَٱنتَصَرُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا ظُلِمُواْۗ وَسَيَعۡلَمُ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوٓاْ أَيَّ مُنقَلَبٖ يَنقَلِبُونَ
verses.translation: (227) Except those [poets] who believe and do righteous deeds and remember Allāh often and defend [the Muslims][1069] after they were wronged. And those who have wronged are going to know to what [kind of] return they will be returned.
